did.abstract:
Charles Franklin Peters (circa 1870-1965) lived in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania and was an amateur photographer. Census records indicated he was a clerk and bookkeeper for a local transit company. Peters was also a member of the fraternal organization the Ancient Order of Kights of the Mystic Chain (AOKMC). Peters is the assumed creator of this collection. He is pictured in many photographs and his daughter, Clara E. Peters, is the only subject in the collection who was explicitely identified.
This collection includes 96 photographs including silver gelatin print postcards and cabinet cards, as well as cyanotype prints. Some prints are hand colored. The bulk the photographs are family portraits, domestic scenes, street scenes, interiors, and photographs of men in theatrical costumes participating in AOKMC rites. There are 10 pornographic photographs that show Peters and another unidentified man engaged in sexual acts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes 96 photographs including silver gelatin print postcards and cabinet cards as well as cyanotype prints. Some prints are hand colored. The bulk the photographs are family portraits, domestic scenes, street scenes, interiors, and photographs of men in theatrical costumes participating in AOKMC rites. There are 10 pornographic photographs that show Peters and another unidentified man engaged in sexual acts.

The collection also includes some of costumes pictured in the photographs. Included are one embellished white linen apron, two brass cuff bracelets, a sword with scabbard and belt, a shield, and a one close helmet.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received at the time of acquisition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Charles Franklin Peters (circa 1870-1965) lived in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, and likely worked as a clerk for a transportation company. He was an amateur photographer and a member of the fraternal organization the Ancient Order Knights of the Mystic Chain (AOKMC). Peters was married to Elizabeth A. Theal and together they had one daughter, Clara E. Peters. Peters was also involved in a sexual relationship with a man, likely another member of the AOKMC.
